{{champion:39}} was reworked 7 months ago and is absolutely a "Human Warrior".

{{champion:164}} was released two years ago. She's Human, and definitely a warrior (if a little bit on the "rogue" side as far as lore goes). If that sounds like a long time ago, keep in mind that there have only been 7 champion releases since Camille (not exactly a lot of room for new "warriors") because they've also released 11 reworks in that timeframe (which reminds me: {{champion:19}} )

Plus immediately prior to {{champion:164}} we saw the release of {{champion:240}} and {{champion:420}}, and saying that either of them aren't "warriors" is just a flat out lie (plus Kled would stab you for that. He'd stab you anyway, but he'd stab you *harder*).

Oh, and don't discount {{champion:141}} (Rhaast). Definitely a warrior, Human at least at the start of the game, and honestly not that much of an Edgelord if you choose Rhaast (Kayn is super edgy, Rhaast is more like a mix of Aku and Deadpool).

In other words... no. There's not even a little bit of an issue here.

Just because Riot releases champions who are **not** fighters doesn't change that they're already the most populous role in the game.
